page.title: 08HOUSING IN WIMBOLDSLEY
page.content: {SCHOOL COTTAGES.}The 3 pairs of semi- detached cottages with a small garden and yard built in 1888 for farm workers are now privately owned. The outside is half brick and at the top black and white. They have heavy framed windows, all the doors are the same--white with black round the edge. The store-room is now a bathroom.The pig-shed now stores fuel.The well is covered up.The pantry still has hooks on which meat was hung.The back door is split like a stable door. {LEA DRIVE}was built in 1948 by the council for farmworkers to rent, only 1 farm worker still lives there.They have been modernised with new doors and double-glazed windows.Extra electric sockets and central heating have been put in.Most are owner occupied. {FARM COTTAGES }are often modernised.
